intro: Quercus wislizeni f. parvula, commonly known as the narrow-leaf rock栎, is a shrub or small tree native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are typically less than 2 inches long. The plant produces small, cup-shaped acorns that are enclosed in a dense, scaly cap. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. This subspecies is adapted to arid conditions and is an important component of the local flora in its native range.
